flawed_nl_solution:
The first group is a third of the class which is (1/3)*45 = <<1/3*45=15>>15 students
There are 15 students in the first group, so there are 45-15 = <<45-15=30>>30 students
The second group is two-fifths of the class which is (2/5)*45 = <<2/5*45=225/2>>225/2 students
There are 225/2 in the second group so there are 30-225/2 = <<30-225/2=-165/2>>-165/2 students left in the third group
#### -165/2

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 18, not 225/2. It appears the value was multiplied by the reciprocal of the intended fraction.
